alert.note: Alert for Aitkin; Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 4:15AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: .Runoff from heavy rain that fell earlier as thunderstorms moved through the region will continue. This may cause flooding as the water works through streams and rivers. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, in east central Minnesota, Aitkin and Pine. In northeast Minnesota, Carlton. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 412 AM CDT Tuesday, thunderstorms earlier in the night produced heavy rain and runoff from those storms continues. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moose Lake, Willow River, Rutledge, Kettle River, Sturgeon Lake, Denham, Arthyde, Ronald, Dads Corner, Banning State Park and Moose Lake State Park. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
